instructor_reflection: I like the course and what we do in it. The assessment through a Tiny CPU is an interesting exercise to the students that teaches them a lot.
cd_teaching_strategies_strengths: Lectures were effective, but hands-on labs were not due to online delivery.
cd_teaching_strategies_suggestions: Proposed Improvement Actions: Lab was taught online. The students did all the labs online but no hardware was used.
cd_course_content_strengths: The course used a bit of Python in addition to C. We also used a new device.
cd_resources_facilities_strengths: Resources were satisfactory as additional boards were purchased.
cd_assessment_measures_strengths: Students were frustrated due to the online delivery and the lack of usage of actual devices.

instructor_reflection: Students regularly seem to have issues with Dynamic Programming, and they find it hard. I recommend additional labs covering this topic. The issue of labs as well as the unrest in the country did not help the assessment results. I believe the assessment result is highly affected by the ups and downs that surrounded students. The topic is difficult and requires concentration and a lot of exercise which, obviously, students could not do and have this year.
cd_course_content_suggestions: PC1.5: Students are finding Dynamic Programming hard. More labs covering this topic should be provided. PC1.6: The situation in the country did not allow to cover this topic in-depth. I believe the score is highly affected by the ups and downs that surrounded students. The topic is difficult and requires concentration and a lot of exercise which, obviously, students could not do and have this year.

instructor_reflection: Since students learn Software engineering principles and develop their capstone projects at the same time, then I move to suggest that the CSC490 course can be a co-requisite to CSC599 instead of a pre-requisite.

instructor_reflection: I would like to bring back the earlier issue of consolidating the contents of CSC310 and MTH307 in addition to the need of more labs as this would help the learning process and subsequently the assessment process. We also need a solution for the hands-on labs in terms of space and teaching support as the number of grad students continue to dwindle.
cd_course_content_suggestions: 1.6 There is no need to dwell on complexity theory, being covered thoroughly in MTH307 (which covers automata theory and complexity theory).
cd_resources_facilities_suggestions: 1.6 There is a constant need for qualified graduate teaching assistants to help with the labs. We need to allocate an adequate budget for lab instructors since the students benefit a lot from lab assignments.
cd_assessment_measures_suggestions: 1.6 Need to move the assessment of this outcome to MTH307 where it is covered properly.
